page.title: 18TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: Lundwood in 1955 was a mixture of three things, roads, canals and railways. There was only one long canal no that shows the canals were being pushed out and railways and trains taking canals place, but still the cars and lorries etc were becoming more and more popular in Lundwood. If we had done a survey from early years canals and railways would be more in use than cars eventhough cars have been invented since the 19 hundreds. Canals and railways were used to transport heavy materials for industry. Cars mean that people can travel far easier and at their own convenience.
